alternatives.transcript: good morning it's good to be with you again and bring you up to date on the state of our business it's been a tough year but a year of major achievements and one of the most exciting I've ever experienced in the business have also been a few bumps and detours along the way but overall we have

have ample reason to be proud of our accomplishments this year unit sales worldwide will be up 4% to 144 billion cigarettes that's well ahead of plan and excluding last year's one-off rush and Export order up a very strong 13 percent sales growth will be balanced with strong gains in Eastern Europe and the Middle East Africa and good solid growth in Asia and the Americas Western Europe is an exception we're experiencing considerable markets

often this and down trading and several of our key Western European markets brought on by a series of sharp excise tax increases that are impacting our business along with everyone else's it's not only reduced our overall rate of sales growth but cut deeply into the growth of our strategic Brands particularly camel and its European Heartland Winston less affected with the smaller European base will be up this year and Salem keeps rolling along and double digits

sales will be up more than seven percent almost 3 billion dollars in earnings despite our substantial investments in marketing and Business Development will be right on target going 15% to 575 million dollars this brings are compounded rate of growth and the four years since the buyout to 11% in unit sales and 23% in be you see far ahead of the other are jrn operating units in our peer group of
companies

cash flow after a couple of technical adjustments will be well ahead of plan as well operating profit margin in Roi demonstrating that we haven't lost sight of the need to run our business efficiently

now delivering plan numbers is never an easy task in our targets are getting tougher every year our performance this year in the face of the difficulties I just mentioned speaks volumes about what I regard as a major strength of our company our ability to search out new opportunities and quickly capitalize on them indeed our performance report card for the year includes the fact that we've been very aggressively building new business bases in countries around the world
old business development is a key element of our growth strategy and nothing is more important to the future of our company
but despite these achievements and lest any of us forget we're dealing in an environment that's tougher and more competitive than ever before and unfortunately it's not going to get any easier

on the one hand there's an intense battle between companies for Market presence volume and share growth consumer loyalty earnings and cash flow and on the other an equally Fierce fight between the industry and those who would restrict our freedoms of communication and Market access governments increasingly see cigarettes as an easy target to fatten their coffers through higher taxes and consumers caught in the middle are turning more and more to Value brands

this is particularly true in Western Europe where as I noted a few minutes ago camel and to a lesser extent Winston are being impacted by the trend we're seeing disturbing parallels to the US market a couple of years ago so there are some concerns but on the positive side it's still a big and growing World Market with continued solid growth of The Prestige American blend segment which is outpacing worldwide market growth and of course a wealth of new Acts
SS opportunities and Eastern Europe Asia and elsewhere

against this background we already have well developed strategies in place that I'm satisfied will successfully guide us in the achievement of our business goals there are two specific strategies this year however that I believe are critical to our ability to continue to grow our business in this increasingly difficult environment they are the revitalization of our key strategic Brands particularly camel and Winston in Europe and an aggressive business
program which ensures a competitive presence for t.i. in all viable new markets
let me speak first to new business

we've seen a tremendous opportunity this year to stake out a strong competitive position in any number of new markets and that's exactly what we've done first in is a big plus of the tobacco business and we aim to be their first whenever it makes good business sense nowhere do we see a better opportunity to grow our business that in Eastern Europe this region of the world represents a market of some 700 billion cigarettes and the demand for Quality consumer goods

kids especially cigarettes is tremendous we're going into these Investments with our eyes wide open recognizing that all of these countries have political and economic problems ranging from manageable to massive we have a clear-cut strategy that we follow in making these investments in short we try to minimize the cost of the investment by getting in early we operate these businesses on a self-sustaining cash flow basis and we look for an attractive rate of return over the

longer term also County heavily on government support in making these Investments and we certainly had that with key government officials moving quickly and decisively to cut through the red tape and get these Investments off the ground our first priority in Eastern Europe not surprisingly as Russia this is the largest of the sea is markets in one with a critical shortage of cigarettes that can be expected to continue for years to come as you know we became the first

American cigarette company to invest in the country when we acquired a controlling interest in a s Petrol in st. Petersburg this operation is the largest and in my opinion the best manage cigarette factory in Russia initially we will continue to produce traditional Soviet brands are working with suppliers of tobacco and other materials to greatly improve quality and add value and eventually introduce our own camel and Winston
current production capacity is in the 18 billion cigarette range and will increase that modestly to 22 billion next year as we add new equipment and rationalized production flow

our second priority in the CIS is the Ukraine where we have acquired controlling interests into manufacturing companies in this 80 billion unit Market production capacity of the two companies located in Libya van kremenchug is about 20 billion cigarettes or 25% of the total Market these Investments along with our Venture in st. Petersburg make us the largest cigarette producer in the CIS

elsewhere in Eastern Europe were already established in Poland with a new plant now under construction and scheduled for production to begin in late 1993 we're currently producing Camel cigarettes at a temporary facility and I'm happy to say that the brand is off to a great start in the local market in Hungary we've acquired a factory where we will initially produce well-known Hungarian Brands and introduce our RJ are trademarks later on this investment gives us the important strategic positioning

thing we need to fully develop the region we're not however confining our development activity to Eastern Europe Asia the region booming economically and with a very high incidence of smoking continues to be a top priority development region China is of particular interest based on sheer size in the fundamental economic change taking place in that country we Remain the only major international company with a sizable local manufacturing presence and what

the verge of getting government approval to double the size of our Factory in Jia men we also continue to invest heavily in Japan Korea Taiwan Thailand and Indonesia and we're exploring options for entry into Cambodia Laos and when allowed Vietnam

in the Middle East and North Africa huge Market of some 230 billion cigarettes and we're already strongly represented with Winston we're growing our export business we've also signed protocol agreements in Morocco Iran in Yemen which provide the basis for greatly expanding our presence in this region I recently spent some time in the region in came away enormously enthused about Prospect for building our business there turkey will be a very big and

potentially very profitable market for us once we start producing locally and be can begin to priced competitively construction of our new Factory is well underway and we expect to be in production as early as April in Latin America Mexico is our top development priority as you know we have a joint venture with LA moderna the largest manufacturer in the market and if successfully launched Winston and will soon relaunch camel and Salem

why us but certainly not least we have converted our license agreement with the tobacco Monopoly and Spain into a joint venture that will substantially increase our profitability in this important Winston and camel Market while allowing us to share in future profit growth and step up the level of marketing investment I could go on but I think you get the picture opportunities are virtually unlimited and we haven't wasted any time in capitalizing on them these Investments at a

a whole new dimension to our business they will significantly broaden our business base accounting for some 25 to 30 percent of total unit sales by 1995 I would expect this portion to be even larger as development projects currently in the works materialize

Bernie's contribution will be significant as well but that's going to be further down the road out-of-pocket expenses will be controlled in the meantime and will not materially affect overall earnings performance

as important business new business that has however our Core Business is still our International Brands camel Winston and Salem as you know are among the top 10 best-selling brands in the world and all three are well positioned in the most viable segment of the market young adult smokers who have a growing preference for American blend cigarettes at carry strongly expressed image values Tamil Winston-Salem have shown strong and consistent growth historically

absorbing the major share of marketing funds and providing an equally important share of volume growth these Brands currently account for two-thirds of our total volume and almost 80% of our marketing Investments not surprisingly then a top priority for us this year has been to revitalize our advertising campaigns and support programs for our key Brands I don't think there's any disagreement that re-energizing Camel and its Western European Heartland is our number

marketing priority by the old world campaign is served the brand well we've taken it about as far as it can go it may be a good defense but it hasn't worked as a good offense and taking share from Marlborough come January we'll be introducing a new camel campaign in Western Europe this campaign the most Innovative campaign that's ever been done for cigarette brand uses the medium of film to plumb the rich Heritage of camel and convey the

the Brand's core image dimensions of Adventure and masculinity in a contemporary and appealing way I'm confident that this campaign will provide the impact entertainment and vitality that consumers expect from one of the best-known and most respected trademarks in the world

we'll continue to support camel through a highly successful Formula 1 sponsorship with Williams and Benetton racing teams this year has been our finest yet with Williams taking the number one spot in the constructors race and Nigel Mansell clinching the world drivers championship and thanks to the outstanding performance and Michael Schumacher and Martin brundle camel Benetton Ford became the first team since 1963 to score points and every single race of the season
we have a window of extraordinary opportunity in Formula One and next you will be leveraging the strong position with the consumer and the trade

camel trophy is our second major sponsorship vehicle for the brand as the event the first Adventure series of its kind in cigarette marketing has retained its popularity over the years and continues to be an important part of the camel marketing program now on the Winston Winston of course is T.I.'s largest volume brand and a brand that's been showing good if not consistent growth I'll be the first to acknowledge that we've been a bit tentative about

but Winston over the years and outside its core markets our support behind the brand has been fragmented and inconsistent our objective in the coming year will be to broaden Winston's appeal to fill in the market gaps that give us a strong double barrel attack against Marlboro

to this end we've developed a new Winston Campaign which was launched in Spain and September and will eventually be rolled out elsewhere in Europe this new campaign capitalizes on the positive aspects of Winston's Heritage and reinforces the Brand's position of freedom and does it in a distinctive and contemporary way to support the campaign will be sponsoring Dennis Conner on arguably the best-known most respected name in the world of sailing in the

394 Whitbread round the world race is highly popular event will be broadcast live via satellite to 60 countries over a nine-month period we also plan to showcase the Connor Whitbread sponsorship through Grassroots marketing program that will take directly to the consumer and trade in order to fully maximize our investment

Salem our number one priority brand in Asia is a different matter Salem has long been successful in carving out a unique territory on its promise of refreshment a position that has been consistently communicated through the High Country campaigning we see no reason to change this campaign but we will update it to give it a more contemporary look and broader appeal Salim will continue to build on its highly successful music and sports a bolide programs in order to be a part of the
lifestyle of our Target group this combination has worked well in the past and should continue to drive the brand rapid growth

so as you can see we are moving forward with the two-pronged strategy I referred to earlier building our International brand franchises and investing in new business this balance will allow us to broaden our business base and expand earnings potential longer-term while continuing to deliver strong earnings and cash flow Grove

there's one other element that we must incorporate in our roadmap for continued success and that is Quality quality and everything we do from producing consistently Superior Products to servicing our customers to dealing with each of our co-workers in the United States there's an election every four years to determine who will lead the country but in business and the election goes on every minute of the day across the counters of hundreds of thousands of stores and shops were

customers State their preferences and determine which company in which product will be the leader we can open new markets and we can find new and better ways to appeal to our customers but unless we build quality into our total operation and make it a permanent state of mind and everything we do we will not be a leader we must remember that quality is more than just an end result it is the all-encompassing attitude we must have from the very beginning

so where does this all take us we head into the new year with excellent prospects for the growth of our business we look for tremendous volume growth next year up 32% to 188 billion cigarettes will surpass domestic company unit sales for the first time marking the largest volume growth in the history of tobacco International sales will grow ten percent passing the three billion dollar Mark in earnings despite heavy investment in New

has will increase 13% to 650 million dollars 1993 will be a watershed year a year in which we will compete aggressively for Market position and consumer loyalty and a year that more than any other in the history of this company will set the stage for our future the transformation of this company over the past year has been mind-boggling as we enter the new year will have 50% more people than a year ago will sell 40%

more cigarettes on a month-to-month basis and perhaps for the first time we can call ourselves a truly International Company the challenge for us in the coming year is to successfully manage this change keeping our base business vibrant and growing assimilating acquired businesses and tapping new business development potential quite a challenge but that isn't anything new the demands that are people around the world this year have been extraordinary and we've responded extraordinarily well

well I'm proud of our performance and proud of our people and tough though the challenge might be I'm confident that at this time next year we'll be wrapping up yet another excellent year and we'll have taken a big step forward in meeting our ambitious growth objectives let me close by thanking you individually for your contribution to the success of our business and wishing you and your family a very happy New Year
